+ # MUNAJ SALES PARTNER INTERVIEW BLUEPRINT
+ **Date**: Interview 001 | **Source**: Sales Partnership Strategy Session
+ 
+ 
+ ## üéØ **Business Model Clarity**
+ 
+ **IPP Strategy Pivot**
+ - Business shifted from direct IPP provision to engine sales to IPP providers
+ - Three IPP partners: Junaid (brother's friend, paid for 3 engines), Kabota (2 engines reserved), Welbeck (no payment yet)
+ - Target: Sell engines to IPP providers who then sell power to end customers
+ - Rationale: IPP business "not profitable" according to Chairman
+ 
+ **Revenue Model**
+ - Engine sales: ‚Ç¶700k USD per unit (~‚Ç¶1.5bn each)
+ - Commission structure: 2% on deals (‚Ç¶50M per ‚Ç¶2.5bn deal)
+ - Target: 4-6 deals annually = ‚Ç¶400M revenue
+ - Customer payback: 1.5-2 years on engine purchase vs power contracts
+ 
+ 
+ ## üìä **Current Stock & Urgency**
+ 
+ **Inventory Pressure**
+ - 13 units of 1.1MW engines
+ - 12 units of 1.5MW engines (priority to move)
+ - 1 unit of 2MW engine
+ - Total: 26 units = ~‚Ç¶39bn tied up in stock
+ - Must sell before new stock arrives (liquidity constraint)
+ 
+ **Competitive Positioning**
+ - MTU engines (Rolls-Royce quality) vs cheaper German competitors (MWM)
+ - Advantage: Stock availability (8-month lead time for competitors)
+ - Disadvantage: Premium pricing vs similar quality alternatives
+ 
+ 
+ ## üéØ **Target Market Intelligence**
+ 
+ **Priority Industries**
+ 1. **Manufacturing** (24/7 operations, can't rely on NEPA/diesel)
+ 2. **Hospitality** (hotels, space constraints favour higher MW units)
+ 3. **Telecoms** (reliable power critical)
+ 
+ **Customer Capacity Assessment**
+ - All target companies can afford engines outright
+ - Decision factor: Do they want to own vs buy power?
+ - Power costs: ‚Ç¶180-200M monthly average
+ - Engine ROI: 1.5-2 year payback period
+ 
+ **Geographic Focus**
+ - Nigeria priority (gas availability + cost advantage)
+ - Regional expansion depends on gas infrastructure and pricing vs diesel
+ 
+ 
+ ## üìß **Outreach Strategy & Challenges**
+ 
+ **Email Effectiveness Debate**
+ - Munaj's experience: "Email doesn't work in Nigeria"
+ - Traditional approach: Word-of-mouth, relationship-based penetration
+ - Proposed volume: 230 emails/week to 3 contacts per company
+ - Compromise: Email for tracking opens, then phone follow-up
+ 
+ **Alternative Channels**
+ - Industry events (Mining Week November, air conditioning conventions)

+ - Business cards: "Business Developer" or "Power Consultant" titles
+ 
+ 
+ ## üîÑ **Sales Process & Timeline**
+ 
+ **End-to-End Process**
+ 1. Lead qualification (existing power setup, expansion vs replacement)
+ 2. Affordability assessment (direct purchase vs IPP route)
+ 3. Site inspection and bill of quantities
+ 4. Gas pipeline requirements (10-year contracts for 2MW+)
+ 5. Pricing: Power-only vs power+gas (3x cost without pipeline)
+ 6. Sales invoice to IPP partner
+ 7. 10-year customer contract (company exits relationship)
+ 
+ **Timeline Management**
+ - Sales cycles: 12-18 months average
+ - Follow-up cadence: Weekly (not daily to avoid frustration)
+ - Meeting capacity: 15-20 companies weekly manageable
+ - Current pipeline: Welbeck 15MW deal (6 months to close, started March)
+

## **Corrected Numbers:**

**Revenue Model Fixed:**
- Engine sales: $700k USD per unit = ‚Ç¶1.1bn each (at ‚Ç¶1,607/$)
- Commission: 2% = ‚Ç¶22M per deal (not ‚Ç¶50M)
- Annual target: 4-6 deals = ‚Ç¶88-132M revenue (not ‚Ç¶400M)

**Stock Inventory Corrected:**
- 30 units of 1.1MW engines (you were right, not 13)
- 12 units of 1.5MW engines (priority)
- 1 unit of 2MW engine
- Total: 43 units = ~‚Ç¶47bn tied up

**MTU Clarification:**
- [MTU Aero Engines AG](https://www.mtu.de/) is indeed a leading German aircraft & industrial gas turbine manufacturer
- Founded 1934, headquartered Munich
- Specialises in commercial/military aircraft engines + industrial gas turbines
- Premium quality, not Rolls-Royce (that's a separate company)

+ - **Deal size**: ‚Ç¶2-3bn+ (vs old ‚Ç¶1.1bn)
+ - **Sales cycle**: 12-18 months
+ - **Pipeline**: 4-6 deals annually
+ 
+ ## üåç **Geographic Strategy**
+ 
+ ### **Primary Markets**
+ 1. **Lagos**: Established industrial base, existing relationships
+ 2. **Northern Nigeria**: AKK pipeline boom, new opportunities
+ 3. **AKK Corridor**: Ajaokuta ‚Üí Abuja ‚Üí Kaduna ‚Üí Kano
+ 
+ ### **AKK Pipeline Opportunity**
+ - **Timeline**: Q1 2025 completion (imminent/completed)
+ - **Impact**: Industrial boom along entire route
+ - **Strategy**: First-mover advantage during expansion phase
+ - **Advantage**: Cheaper gas access = more power demand
+ 
+ ## üé™ **Event Strategy**
+ 
+ ### **June 2025 Lagos Events (Confirmed Attendance)**
+ 1. **WHX Lagos & WHX Labs Lagos** (June 2-4)
+ 2. **Food & Beverage West Africa** (June 10-12)
+ 3. **ALWINDOOR Expo Nigeria** (June TBC)
+ 
+ ### **Northern Nigeria Events**
+ - **Kano International Trade Fair** (Nov 22-Dec 6) - Priority
+ - **Abuja International Trade Fair** (Sep 25-Oct 6) - Government focus
+ - **Niger State Trade Fair** (July 22-26) - AKK pipeline route
+ 
+ ## üîÑ **Operational Workflow**
+ 
+ ### **Lead Generation**
+ 1. **Heavy research**: 8-12 hours per target company
+ 2. **Team approach**: 3 people per account
+ 3. **Warm introductions**: Industry connections, events
+ 4. **Pain point identification**: Power costs, reliability issues
+ 
+ ### **Sales Process**
+ 1. **Initial contact**: Warm introduction preferred
+ 2. **Needs assessment**: Site visit, power audit
+ 3. **Solution design**: Custom engine + IPP provider match
+ 4. **Proposal**: Detailed ROI, implementation plan
+ 5. **Closing**: Contract with IPP provider coordination
+ 
+ ### **Post-Sale**
+ 1. **Engine delivery**: From our inventory
+ 2. **IPP coordination**: Junaid/Kabota/Welbeck installation
+ 3. **Commission collection**: 2% on engine sale
+ 4. **Relationship maintenance**: Ongoing support, future opportunities
+ 
+ ## üéØ **Immediate Priorities**
+ 
+ ### **June 2025**
+ - **Event preparation**: Lagos events (WHX, Food & Beverage, ALWINDOOR)
+ - **Northern research**: AKK pipeline company identification
+ - **Inventory strategy**: Prioritise 1.5MW engines for higher commissions
+ 
+ ### **Q3 2025**
+ - **Northern expansion**: Kano, Abuja, Kaduna market entry
+ - **Pipeline building**: 10-15 qualified prospects
+ - **IPP coordination**: Strengthen Junaid/Kabota relationships
+ 
+ ### **Q4 2025 - Q1 2026**
+ - **Deal closure**: First 2-3 deals from pipeline
+ - **Inventory reduction**: Clear priority engines
+ - **Market positioning**: Establish northern Nigeria presence
+ 
+ ---
+ 
+ **Key Insight**: The shift from high-volume outreach to account-based sales represents a fundamental strategy change focused on relationship-building and deal quality over quantity.
